info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Berks and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1259 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pottstown, or 11 miles east of Reading, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Public reported pea size hail near Birdsboro. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pottstown, Birdsboro, Schwenksville, Bally, Bechtelsville, Gilbertsville, Stowe, Boyertown, St. Lawrence, Pottsgrove, Amity Gardens, Sanatoga, Halfway House, South Pottstown, Lorane and Reiffton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern and southeastern Pennsylvania.
